attributes.action: Probe into Ryanair (review conduct, unlawful market advantages & confirm fines)
attributes.additional_details: The probe shall target to identify: (a) whether Ryanair is in full compliance with laws and regulations, specifically in applying EU Regulation 261/2004 (b) whether Ryanair, by not or not fully or not promptly complying with EU Regulation 261/2004, generates unlawful, illegal advantages over other airlines and therefore causes a dislocation of markets, (c) meaningful actions against Ryanair's business practices, take enforcements to stop those and consider appropriate fines where relevant.
attributes.background: Following a recent cancellation incident caused by strike actions of Ryanair’s staff & showing lag of willingness to comply with existing laws and regulations (specifically EU Regulation 261/2004), I call upon the UK Gov., relevant bodies & secretaries to probe Ryanair's code of conduct / business.

rejection.details:
Airlines are regulated by the Civil Aviation Authority, which is independent.

You can find out how to make a complaint here:

https://www.caa.co.uk/Passengers/Resolving-travel-problems/How-the-CAA-can-help/How-to-make-a-complaint/
